documents: Valid South African passport (6+ months validity)
financial_proof: Bank statements showing funds for first year
Sponsor affidavit of support if sponsored

application_process.step_1: Receive I-20 from university and pay SEVIS fee
application_process.step_3: Schedule visa interview at US Consulate (Cape Town/Johannesburg/Durban)
application_process.step_4: Attend visa interview with all documents
application_process.step_5: Await visa decision (usually same day or within few days)

common_questions: Why do you want to study in the US?
Why did you choose this university/program?
How will you finance your studies?
What are your plans after graduation?
Do you have ties to South Africa that will bring you back?
tips: Demonstrate strong ties to South Africa
Show clear academic and career goals

work_authorization.post_graduation: Optional Practical Training (OPT) for 12 months (36 months for STEM)

documents: Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) from UK university
financial_proof: Bank statements showing £1,334/month for living costs (London) or £1,023/month (outside London)
Plus full tuition fees for first year
Funds must be held for 28 consecutive days

application_process.step_3: Pay visa fee (£363) and health surcharge

work_authorization.during_studies: Up to 20 hours/week during term time, full-time during holidays
work_authorization.post_graduation: Graduate Route visa allows 2 years work (3 years for PhD graduates)

documents: Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE) from Australian university
Health insurance (OSHC) for full study period
financial_proof: Plus tuition fees and travel costs
Total typically AUD $40,000-$70,000 for first year

australia.validity: Duration of course plus 1-4 months depending on course length

work_authorization.during_studies: Up to 48 hours per fortnight during studies
work_authorization.post_graduation: Temporary Graduate visa (485) allows 2-4 years work depending on qualification

documents: Letter of acceptance from Canadian university
financial_proof: Bank statements, scholarship letters, or sponsor documents
Total typically CAD $25,000-$50,000 for first year
additional_requirements: Medical exam (if from certain countries or studying certain programs)

canada.validity: Usually duration of study program plus 90 days

work_authorization.during_studies: Up to 20 hours/week during studies, full-time during breaks
work_authorization.post_graduation: Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) for 8 months to 3 years depending on program length

h1b_visa.description: Specialty occupation visa for skilled workers
h1b_visa.process: Employer files petition → Lottery selection → Visa application
h1b_visa.duration: 3 years, renewable once for total of 6 years
h1b_visa.path_to_pr: Employer can sponsor for Green Card (EB-2/EB-3)

requirements: Extraordinary ability in sciences, arts, education, business, or athletics
Job offer or contract in area of expertise
o1_visa.advantages: No cap, faster processing, can lead to Green Card

skilled_worker_visa.description: For skilled workers with job offers
requirements: Job offer from UK employer with sponsor license
skilled_worker_visa.process: Job offer → Certificate of Sponsorship → Visa application
skilled_worker_visa.path_to_pr: Indefinite Leave to Remain after 5 years

global_talent_visa.description: For leaders or potential leaders in academia, research, arts, or tech
requirements: Exceptional talent or promise in field
global_talent_visa.advantages: No salary threshold, path to settlement in 3 years

streams: Medium-term stream (4 years, pathway to PR)

skilled_independent_visa.advantages: No employer sponsorship required, direct PR pathway

provincial_nominee_program.process: Provincial nomination → Express Entry or direct application

eb2_eb3.processing_time: 2-10 years depending on country of birth
eb2_eb3.priority_date: South Africans typically have shorter wait times

eb1.advantages: No labor certification required, faster processing

indefinite_leave_to_remain.requirements: 5 years continuous residence on qualifying visa

employer_nomination_scheme.requirements: 3 years on TSS visa, employer nomination

skilled_independent.advantages: No employer required, can live anywhere in Australia

express_entry_pr.description: Direct permanent residence through Express Entry

1_year_before: Research visa requirements for target countries
Take language proficiency tests if needed

solutions: Maintain consistent bank balance for required period
Consider education loans with proper documentation
Get documents apostilled through Department of International Relations
Use credential evaluation services for academic documents
Show strong ties to South Africa (family, property, job prospects)
Be honest and confident in responses

application_strategy: Start visa process immediately after university acceptance
Apply for multiple visas if considering multiple countries
Keep all documents organized and easily accessible
Consider using immigration lawyers for complex cases
financial_planning: Budget for visa fees, health insurance, and living costs
cultural_preparation: Connect with South African communities abroad
Prepare for climate and lifestyle changes
Learn about local laws and regulations

source_verification.visa_requirements: Current requirements from consulates and embassies
source_verification.processing_times: Based on recent processing data and official estimates
